comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
John P Allix, Yorkshire Huss A/A PM Rlys & Docks, 2th Div HB. Address on Medal Card shown as The Hermtage, Stockton on Forest, York.
According to an online family tree John Peter Allix was the son of Charles Peter Allix and Laura Agneta Wellington Bevan. He was born in 1879 in Swaffham Prior, Cambridgeshire. He died 1 March 1959 at Blackthorn House, West Byfleet, Surrey.
In 1911 he was described as a Railway Official and was living at 114 Bishopthorpe Road, York (handy for York Railway Station).

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: John Peter Allix birth reg. 4th qr 1879 in Newmarket (spans the boundaries of the counties of Cambridgeshire and Suffolk) (FreeBMD) John Peter Allix Born:27th July 1879, Swaffham Prior, Cambridgeshire, England Died:1st March 1959, West Byfleet, Surrey, England Batting:Right-hand batsman Relations:Brother: CIL Allix Teams:Cambridgeshire (Minor Counties Championship: 1901-1903); Durham (Minor Counties Championship: 1905); cricketarchive.com/Durham/Players/127/127428/127428.html Brother: Charles Israel Loraine Allix Born:1st December 1872, Swaffham Prior, Cambridgeshire, England Died:13th March 1960, Swaffham Prior, Cambridgeshire, England Relations:Brother: JP Allix Teams:Cambridgeshire (Minor Counties Championship: 1904-1905) cricketarchive.com/Durham/Players/127/127428/127428.html

comment._content: 6th of 7 children. John married Virginia Norman. They had three children: Charles Richard Peter, John Hereward and Michael Du Val etc See pages 8, 12 www.pennyghael.org.uk/Bevan.pdf Descendant of William the Conqueror www.william1.co.uk/w168.htm
